title: Venus in Cancer
summary: Affection centers on safety, care, and familiarity. Connection deepens through tenderness, memory, and creating a sense of home. The opportunity is to nurture bonds while honoring your own boundaries.

meaning.headline: Relating turns protective, soft, and emotionally attuned.

frames.text: Venus in Cancer values emotional security, shared history, and gestures that feel personal.
Care-taking and creating cozy environments become expressions of love.
Private time may feel more nourishing than public plans.
Nostalgia and memory color preferences today.
Closeness requires self-sacrifice or emotional fusion.

frictions: Using caretaking to avoid your own needs

do: Name what helps you feel safe before giving to others.
Create soft plans with room to opt out.
Ask directly for the care you need.
avoid: Expecting others to intuit your needs
Holding grudges instead of speaking up
Assuming comfort means no change is needed

reusable_lines.text: Care can be warm and clear at the same time.
Nurture the bond, and name what you need too.

forbidden_claims: Predictions of family or relationship outcomes
allowed_framing: Supportive framing: can heighten tenderness and receptivity
Agency-forward language: you choose how to care and receive
Contextual framing: safety helps when paired with boundaries

sources: Venus as relating/values archetype in daily cycles
